div.font:
#1.1 Check if User Allows Data Sharing
Verify if the user has agreed to share their data.
#1.2 Send Data if Allowed
If allowed, send the data to the server and set up to update again in 30 days.
#1.3 Handle Skipped Permission
If the user skips, wait 30 days and then show again notice.
#1.4 Handle Closed by Button
If the user closes the prompt / notice, check & show again after 7 days.
#1.5 Do Not Send Data if Disallowed
If the user does not allow data sharing, do not send any data to the server.

switch.text: #1.1 Check if User Allows Data Sharing...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 127px; margin-left: 2px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 8px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; font-weight: bold; white-space: nowrap;
div.font:
#2.1 Send Non-Sensitive Data
Users allowed, send their non-sensitive data to the server.
#2.2 Schedule Next Update
Set up to send data again in 30 days to keep it up-to-date.
#2.3 Never shows the Notice again.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 147px; margin-left: 632px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 8px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; font-weight: bold; white-space: nowrap;
div.font:
#3.1 Show Notice After 30 Days If the user skips, show the notice again in 30 days.
#3.2 Repeat the Process
Follow the same process as before.

switch.text: #3.1 Show Notice After 30 Days If the user skips, sh...
